page.title: 20A SCHOOL VISIT
page.content: ON TUESDAY 17 SEPTEMBER ,1985 , ELEVEN CHILDREN FROM ST ABBS SCHOOL ,THEIR TEACHER AND TWO MUMS CLIMBED INTO THE SCHOOL MINI-BUS AND SET OFF FOR A VISIT TO EDINBURGH .WHEN WE ARRIVED , WE HAD TO WAIT A FEW MINUTES BEFORE GOING TO SEE THE CHINESE WARRIOR EXHIBITION . IT WAS VERY CROWDED BUT WE MANAGED TO SEE ALL THE EXHIBITS THEY WERE VERY INTERESTING .WE GOT BACK IN THE BUS AND WENT OF TO THE BUTTERFLY FARM . FIRST DAVID TOLD US ABOUT THE LIFE CYCLE THEN HE SHOWED US THE INSECTS AND HOW THEY ARE CAMOUFLAGED .HE TOOK US IN TO WATCH THE NEW BUTTERFLIES BEING SET FREE IN THE GREENHOUSE . WE SAW ONE EMERGING FROM A PUPA .WE COULD EXPLORE BY OURSELVES AND LOTS OF THE BUTTERFLIES CAME AND SETTLED ON OUR HANDS AND HEADS .WE SAW THEM EATING ROTTING FRUIT CALLED MISH-MASH.
